Wonders of the Modern World.name: American Icons & Innovations
Wonders of the Modern World.description: Test your knowledge of iconic American landmarks, inventions, and corporate trademarks. From flags to computers, this quiz explores the symbols and creations that define modern America.

questions.text: How many stars are on the American flag?
questions.hint: The number of stars corresponds to the number of states in the U.S.

questions.text: Where is the Louvre museum?
questions.hint: This museum is in a European capital along the Seine River.

questions.text: What is the 7-Eleven company's trademarked name for its super-large sodas?
questions.hint: The name suggests a large, satisfying drink for convenience store customers.

questions.text: What is the 7-Eleven company's trademarked name for its super-large sodas?
questions.hint: The name suggests a large, satisfying drink for convenience store customers.

questions.text: Where is the Frank Lloyd Wright-designed house known as Falling Water?
questions.hint: This architectural masterpiece is in a state known for its steel industry.

questions.text: What was the original name of the Apple Macintosh XL computer?
questions.hint: This name was a nod to Steve Jobs’ daughter, used for an earlier Apple model.

questions.text: How many spikes are on the Statue of Liberty's crown?
questions.hint: The number of spikes symbolizes the seven continents or seas.

questions.text: What internet company goes by the acronym AOL?
questions.hint: This company was a pioneer in dial-up internet services in the 1990s.
